data.name: lblSkyDriveClientId.Help
data.value: The SkyDrive's "Client ID" you'll use to connect this web site.

data.name: lblSkyDriveInfo.Text
data.value:
Don't have a SkyDrive account? Click here to create an account.

Once you have a SkyDrive account, you'll have to create an 'Application' for this web site to connect to your SkyDrive.

Notes:
  • NOTE: At this time SkyDrive does not provide permanent URLs, not even for public files.

How to generate a 'Client ID' and 'Client Secret':

  1. Go to https://manage.dev.live.com/Applications/Create to create an application (provide an 'Application Name', choose a language, and click on 'I Accept')
  2. Take note of the 'Client ID' and 'Client secret' that SkyDrive created for you.
  3. Leave the 'Redirect domain:' empty, and choose 'Yes' for "Is Mobile Client app?". Save the configured settings.
  4. Set the "Client ID" and "Client secret" on this form, and save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page, and re-open this form (Click on the pencil for this Folder Type on the 'Folder Type Definitions' dialog) to continue with the authorization process.

Once you have your 'Client ID' and 'Client Secret' keys, you can connect this web site to your SkyDrive account.

How to connect this web site to SkyDrive:

  1. Click on the 'Request Connection' link. A new window, on the SkyDriive's web site (oauth.live.com) will be opened.
  2. If you are not already logged into your SkyDrive account, you will be prompted to log in.
  3. An 'Allow access?' dialog will be presented. Click on 'Yes'.
  4. The pagep will be refreshed, and it will be blank (empty). The page's URL in the window's Address Bar will look like similar to 'https://oauth.live.com/desktop?code=bb1024aa-dbad-6aa6-2ac6-a54c38ed3cb0'.
  5. Copy the code you're given, in the Popup window's Address bar (in this example, it is 'bb1024aa-dbad-6aa6-2ac6-a54c38ed3cb0'), and paste it into the "Authorization code" textbox found on this page.
  6. Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on this page.
  7. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page.

How to disconnect this web site from SkyDrive (how to disallow this web site from accessing your SkyDrive account):

  1. Use the 'Clear Connection' link found on this page to remove the link between SkyDrive and this web site.
  2. Go to the Live Connect Developer Center.
  3. Click on your Application, and then click on 'Delete Application'.

data.name: lblSkyDriveIsDisabled.Help
data.value: You can use this setting to temporarily 'turn off' all access to the configured SkyDrive account.

data.name: lblSkyDriveTest.Help
data.value: Click on the [Test] button to verify the configured settings.

data.name: lblSkyDriveClientSecret.Help
data.value: The SkyDrive's "Client secret" realated with the "Client ID".

data.name: lblEnforceReadOnlyAccess.Help
data.value:
Use this option to prevent any update on the SkyDrive repository.
Files creation, update or rename requests will be ignored.
This setting is useful if you want to 'plug' a SkyDrive repository you already have, ensuring that its content will not be updated in any way from the DotNetNuke site.

data.name: MissingCredentials.Text
data.value: Please check the provided SkyDrive Credentials.

data.name: valSkyDriveClientId.ErrorMessage
data.value: Please type your Access Key ID.

data.name: valSkyDriveClientSecret.ErrorMessage
data.value: Please type your Secret Access Key.

data.name: ConfigureLicenseFirst.Text
data.value:
Your license is invalid, or not suitable for your current environment.
Without a license key, this product is fully functional on any 'localhost' or '*.local' site.
Please configure your License before setting up the SkyDrive options.

data.name: lblSkyDriveConnectionStatus.Help
data.value: Tells if for the given "Client ID" and "Client secret", a connection with SkyDrive has been already established or not.

data.name: ConnectionMissingClientIdAndSecret.Message
data.value:
How to generate a 'Client ID' and 'Client Secret':

  1. Go to https://manage.dev.live.com/Applications/Create to create an application (provide an 'Application Name', choose a language, and click on 'I Accept')
  2. Take note of the 'Client ID' and 'Client secret' that SkyDrive created for you.
  3. Leave the 'Redirect domain:' empty, and choose 'Yes' for "Is Mobile Client app?". Save the configured settings.


Note: Expand 'Information' (clicking on 'Show / Hide') for complete information about the authorization process.

data.name: SkyDriveAuthorizationMessage.Text
data.value:
SkyDrive Configuration

Next Steps:

  • You can close this window.
  • Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on the configuration page (that you should have already open).
  • Save the Settings just configured by clicking on the 'Update' link found on the configuration page.

data.name: ConnectionMissing.Message
data.value:
Your web site is not yet connected to your SkyDrive account.

Important: Verify the 'Client ID' and 'Client secret' are right. If it is needed, update them and click on 'Update' to save their values before browsing back to this dialog and clicking on 'Request Connection'.

  1. Click on the 'Request Connection' link. A new window, on the SkyDriive's web site (oauth.live.com) will be opened.
  2. If you are not already logged into your SkyDrive account, you will be prompted to log in.
  3. An 'Allow access?' dialog will be presented. Click on 'Yes'.
  4. The pagep will be refreshed, and it will be blank (empty). The page's URL in the window's Address Bar will look like similar to 'https://oauth.live.com/desktop?code=bb1024aa-dbad-6aa6-2ac6-a54c38ed3cb0'.
  5. Copy the code you're given, in the Popup window's Address bar (in this example, it is 'bb1024aa-dbad-6aa6-2ac6-a54c38ed3cb0'), and paste it into the "Authorization code" textbox found on this page.
  6. Click on the 'Establish Connection' link found on this page.
  7. Save the Settings by clicking on the 'Update' link found on this page.

Note: Expand 'Information' (clicking on 'Show / Hide') for complete information about the authorization process.

data.name: lblEnableTempUrls.Help
data.value:
When enabled , direct (temporary) URLs will be generated for the SkyDrive files.

'Hide Files Location' takes precedence over this setting.

NOTE: At this time SkyDrive does not provide permanent URLs, not even for public files.

data.name: lblRootFolder.Help
data.value:
You can choose any (already created) private or shared SkyDrive folder to act as the root folder regarding the connection from this web site (or you can leave this setting blank to use the SkyDrive root folder).

This allows you to provide a segmented view of your SkyDrive space contents, instead of providing access to all the content.

Let's say you have lots of folders on your account, and you want to access from this web site just a specific folders tree, not everything.

Example 1: myfolder/mysubfolder
Example 2: MyWebSite/
etc.

data.name: cmdClearConnection.Message
data.value: Please remember to click on "Update" to confirm the drop action. Note: To really drop the connection, you must unauthorize the Application from your SkyDrive account.

data.name: lblHideFilesLocation.Help
data.value: The files will be like served directly from your web site (not linked from their real location).

data.name: CannotEstablishConnection.Text
data.value:
The connection to SkyDrive could not be established.

Important: Please verify the 'Client ID' and 'Client secret' are right. If it is needed, udate them and click on 'Update' to save their values before browsing back to this dialog and clicking on 'Request Connection'.

Error:

data.name: CannotGetAuthorizationURL.Text
data.value: The Authorization URL could not be generated. Please verify the SkyDrive application was created, and the provided Client ID and Secret are valid. Error:

data.name: MappingNotUnique.ErrorMessage
data.value: There is already a mapping featuring the same key settings.

data.name: AuthorizationCodeMissing.Text
data.value: The Authorization Code is missing. Use the 'Request Connection' link to get it.

data.name: lblSkyDriveAuthorizationCode.Help
data.value: During the authorization process, SkyDrive will generate this code for you. Once it is given to you, it should be pasted here.

data.name: lblClearDataCache.Help
data.value:
To improve the performance of the provider, DNNGlobalStorage cache(for a short period of time) the remote data structure.

If you make a change directly in the remote storage (not from the DNN site), and very quickly perform a 'Sinchonize' operations, it could be the new file(s) are not yet visible. In this case, you can use this option to force the cache to be cleared up.
